info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 9:30AM EDT until April 5 at 5:32AM EDT by NWS Charleston WV
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Little Sandy River At Grayson affecting Carter and Greenup Counties.
For the Little Sandy River...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Sandy River at Grayson.
* WHEN...Until late tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, the buildings next to river gage. Also, water starts to flow onto Route 773 and in the Dixie Park area just past I-64 bridge. State Route 1910 floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 20.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this morning to 22.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening to 12.3 feet early Sunday morning. It will rise to 20.1 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.3 feet on 01/26/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 930 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT
